skill.name: markdown-toc
skill.description: Use when generating or updating Table of Contents in markdown files. Supports multiple files, glob patterns, configurable header levels, and various insertion modes. Triggered by "generate toc", "update toc", "table of contents", "add toc to markdown".
skill.summary: Use when generating or updating Table of Contents in markdown files. Supports multiple files, glob p...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation for a Python TOC generator script. No executable code, network calls, or sensitive file access within the skill itself. The referenced script uses standard library only for markdown file processing.

content.value_statement: Manually creating and updating Table of Contents for markdown files is time consuming and error prone. This skill automatically extracts headers, generates anchor links, and inserts a properly formatted TOC with GitHub-compatible formatting.
actual_capabilities: Supports batch processing with glob patterns and recursive search
Creates GitHub-compatible anchor links with proper formatting
Smart insertion modes: auto, top, or marker-based placement
Configurable header level filtering and custom TOC titles
Dry-run mode to preview changes before applying
limitations: Only processes markdown files with .md or .markdown extension
Does not support nested bullet points in TOC beyond standard indentation
Cannot generate TOC for binary or non-markdown document formats
Anchor generation follows GitHub rules which may not match all platforms

use_cases.title: Update project documentation
use_cases.description: Automatically generate fresh TOC for all markdown files in a documentation directory

use_cases.title: Maintain README navigation
use_cases.description: Keep table of contents synchronized with evolving project documentation

use_cases.title: Standardize TOC format
use_cases.description: Apply consistent TOC markers and formatting across multiple documentation files

prompt_templates.title: Simple TOC generation
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate TOC for a single file

best_practices: Always run with --dry-run first to preview TOC output before applying changes
Use --min-level and --max-level to filter headers for cleaner navigation
Use marker insertion mode with custom markers for precise TOC placement
anti_patterns: Running without dry-run on important files that lack version control
Processing files with duplicate headers without checking for conflicts
Using default levels on files with very deep header hierarchies

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: Only markdown files with .md, .markdown, or .mdown extensions. Other formats are skipped.

faq.question: What header levels are included by default?
faq.answer: By default, H2 and H3 headers are included. Use --min-level and --max-level to customize.

faq.question: Can I use this with other AI tools like Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports claude, codex, and claude-code. The script works standalone too.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, all processing happens locally. No data is sent to external servers or APIs.

faq.question: TOC appears in wrong location, how to fix?
faq.answer: Use --insert marker mode with explicit markers like <!-- TOC --> for precise placement.

faq.question: How does this compare to VS Code TOC extensions?
faq.answer: This is a CLI tool for batch processing. VS Code extensions offer UI integration but require GUI.
